plot: Dipper tries to impress Wendy by going along with her and her friends to an abandoned convenience store that may be haunted.

Dipper develops a crush on Wendy and attempts to portray himself as a mature teenager (he is really 12 years old, but is passing himself off as a 13-year-old) so he can hang out with her and her friends. But when Dipper, Mabel, Wendy and Wendy's friends visit an abandoned convenience store, they discover it is haunted by elderly ghosts who hate teenagers.—Anonymous

Dipper develops a crush on Wendy and asks to hang out with her and her friends. When asked, he passes himself and Mabel off as 13, technically teens (they're both really 12). The gang head out to the edge of town and break into a closed-down convenience store that is supposedly haunted by the couple who died while running it. Meanwhile, Grunkle Stan loses the TV remote and is stuck watching an old-fashioned, black and white movie about a Dutchess and her lover.—allihartz
